alert.note: Alert for Atlantic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 8:16PM EDT until July 26 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Atlantic County in southern New Jersey... * Until 1215 AM EDT. * At 816 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported multiple cars stuck in flooded waters near the intersection of English Creek Ave and US Route 40. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Atlantic City, Pleasantville, Brigantine, Northfield, Absecon, Estell Manor, Port Republic, Pomona, and Mays Landing. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 34 and 44. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 2 and 13. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
